top_comments.comment: Omg...  "Was that just my stomach growling or was that a child?".... LOL  That was so funny on so many levels, Emily!!! LOLLL
Here’s how old I am: I remember Cheryl Tiegs being the face of CoverGirl, lol!

I feel like those Milani powder blushes would be great to mix together and get whatever kind of tone you want! I feel like people often forget you can MIX blush and other face products. If a blush is too deep I just dip back and forth between my blush and my face powder and it lightens it!

I'm learning that I am way more particular about my shimmers than I thought. I want the light shades to be as creamy as a Color Pop highlighter if possible! I'll build difficult dark shades but I lost all patience with flaky light ones. Since a lot of holiday looks really rely on those shimmers would you please point out which ones you think are creamy age friendly ones? I think this CG palette fit pretty well! ♡Love you! Prayers for your mom and all of you. 😌🙏💝☮🕉
sometimes you and Allie Glines are in sync.

comments_since_last_sample.body: Emily, I really love your reviews and tutorials! I have been watching your videos since 2009, and you have always been my favorite beauty guru! I was wondering if you could do a video on older makeup products, that have been around before YouTube was a thing. I think it would be super cool!
Nikki Taylor is doing commercials for that make up right now once again. She looks great. Remember when she was in that accident?
The palette is beeeeeauuuutiful but it looks like the many , many palettes I own in that color story. And I want it 😭 I like the CoverGirl shadow formula.

I thought this was a pregnancy announcement..

You use "expecting"and delivery " in your picture and I was like 😲😲😲😲
When you try new mascaras, I would love to see it on the upper AND lower lashes, because I usually use just one mascara, and I have watery eyes, so the lower lashes are important for me! :)

So much new cruelty free stuff! I’m intrigued by the reformulated covergirl eyeshadow, because their shadow tends to be a bit powdery and  not pigmented, too many shimmers, not enough mattes. It might have passed muster 10 years ago, but not today lol. Hopefully they’ve updated to a more modern quality formula.

I really like that the covergirl brow pen has a spoolie! Cause I always have to brush my brows into place to know where I’m going to put the brow pen, and none of the other pens have spoolies for that!

I feel like those Milani powder blushes would be great to mix together and get whatever kind of tone you want! I feel like people often forget you can MIX blush and other face products. If a blush is too deep I just dip back and forth between my blush and my face powder and it lightens it!
I’m not opposed to CG Clean makeup but I’d like a better bottle!
"I've got a few things on my cheeks today." Em's Happy Place

I'm learning that I am way more particular about my shimmers than I thought. I want the light shades to be as creamy as a Color Pop highlighter if possible! I'll build difficult dark shades but I lost all patience with flaky light ones. Since a lot of holiday looks really rely on those shimmers would you please point out which ones you think are creamy age friendly ones? I think this CG palette fit pretty well! ♡Love you! Prayers for your mom and all of you. 😌🙏💝☮🕉
sometimes you and Allie Glines are in sync.
